text: What's up, outliers? Quick market update. We're going to focus on the broad market and the FOMC statement for today because I think it's kind of a big deal. So it's worth spending a few minutes understanding what happened today and what that means for us going forward. So what happened today is we all probably have heard at this point, the Fed has selected to decrease rates by 50 basis point. Now for those that don't know, it's kind of a mixed view in my opinion. And the reason why I say it's a mixed view is because of a few things. It primarily comes down to how calculated of a path the Fed has taken so far with respect to rates. And then this near term acceleration is slightly interesting to me. So when I take a look at some of the primary inflation driven metrics, right? So we can see what they're expecting core PCE to be and what it was that they're clearly showing that they think inflation is under control that unemployment is strong, that the economy overall is strong. And I can see that perspective. But I think the relatively last minute pivot to a 50 BIPS cut versus 25 is actually quite telling because everything that we've done so far has been like very slow, very controlled, very, it seems like very considerate. And if there was going to be a 50 basis point cut in this cycle and it was projected like
